snippet: Mohamed Morsi, the Egyptian president, took the action after the deadliest attack on Egypt’s military in years.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt fires his intelligence chief and other top security officials in a sweeping response by his new government to the killings of 16 soldiers in the Sinai Peninsula; announces that he will replace the head of the military police, several Interior Ministry officials and the head of the presidential guard. Photo, Map (M)

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM; Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from El Arish, and Alan Cowell from London

lead_paragraph: EL ARISH, Egypt -- President Mohamed Morsi fired his intelligence chief and other top security officials on Wednesday in a sweeping response by his new government to the killings of 16 soldiers in the Sinai Peninsula.The far-reaching purge affected officials accused of lapses that contributed to the deaths of the soldiers, and others who probably played no role but were seen as too closely tied to remnants of Egypt's old order. Mr. Morsi announced that he would replace the head of the military police, several Interior Ministry officials and the head of the presidential guard.

headline.main: Egypt Leader Fires Spy Chief and Governor Over Soldier Deaths
